channel.title: Is this possible?
channel.description:
is it possible to run a php server on a vps where i the server checks some data evrey 20 second and put it into the database?
just like an rsps source a little cmd with it
or what is smart to do?
i need to check a mail box where 500 mails will be recieved evrey day , it will take way to long to load evrey time you load the page

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:7, topic:542622”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=661497.msg4421647#msg4421647 date=1398729975]

Better not to use php. Better to even use Java imo but if you want to use PHP you can download xampp.

If it’s for a mail server I’m not sure how Java would work out for this.

Anyways, @OP read up on Cron jobs, if you’re still having problems, just post a reply here and I’ll try to help some more.
[/quote]
I’m assuming you have a lack of Java knowledge. Java Mail API, I’m sure there are others out there too.

And yes a cron job is what I’d recommend also. You can do this nicely in Ruby.[/quote]

I don’t, haha. I have knowledge of website development, so I suggested the website method of doing this.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:6, topic:542622”][quote author=Bullos link=topic=661497.msg4421707#msg4421707 date=1398752105]
It needs to get mail from gmail and sort it by name and date
[/quote]

Get the proper SMTP server data from Gmail, and then set up a Cron Job/Scheduled Task, as suggested.[/quote]
*IMAP. I don’t think SMTP will let him receive mail through gmail.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:3, topic:542622”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=661497.msg4421597#msg4421597 date=1398718271]
Better not to use php. Better to even use Java imo but if you want to use PHP you can download xampp.
[/quote]
If it’s for a mail server I’m not sure how Java would work out for this.

Anyways, @OP read up on Cron jobs, if you’re still having problems, just post a reply here and I’ll try to help some more.[/quote]
I’m assuming you have a lack of Java knowledge. Java Mail API, I’m sure there are others out there too.

And yes a cron job is what I’d recommend also. You can do this nicely in Ruby.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Bullos:

It needs to get mail from gmail and sort it by name and date

Get the proper SMTP server data from Gmail, and then set up a Cron Job/Scheduled Task, as suggested.

Read full topic

@xx_matty_xx wrote:

PHP is turing complete and has SMTP IMAP libraries available. So does Java. Take your pick.

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Bullos:

i need to check a mail box where 500 mails will be recieved evrey day , it will take way to long to load evrey time you load the page

I’m confused on what you need to do this for… But anyways, is the email being ran from your VPS? Assuming your VPS is Windows, I would look into setting up Scheduled Tasks. If your VPS happens to be Linux, check out Cron Jobs. If you’re running the SMTP server (or IMAP, POP3) from a website host, it most likely is running Linux, in that case Cron Jobs would be ideal.

tl;dr - If you’re using Windows, read about Scheduled Tasks. If you’re using Linux, read about Cron Jobs.

Ashi:

Better not to use php. Better to even use Java imo but if you want to use PHP you can download xampp.

If it’s for a mail server I’m not sure how Java would work out for this.

Anyways, @OP read up on Cron jobs, if you’re still having problems, just post a reply here and I’ll try to help some more.

Read full topic
